title: Toxic toxicity

replies.body: Pretty much!
Boi u quick
that's what she said
Yeah =(

i remember i had level 5 honor, i inted one game becuase i was being trolled and i got banned 14 days. the other players no punishment against them lol.

just recently ive been reporting players that admit to griefing/inting/ruining the game in a not so hehe xd way and still nothing happens.

I wonder if i admitted to ruining a game if i would get perm banned immediately after the game or not.

I found it. In total, if you think "support fiora" and the decent cs games aren't feeding, then it's a total of 4 games of inting in the month leading up to the ban. 9 games total that might have counted in the month leading up to the ban. The game that received the ban was the only game of hard inting from the start of the game, but there was still obvious inting in the others.


https://i.gyazo.com/fe116243e639d871f20d8f8f71a43001.png 0/7/2 with 82 cs on your main champion really? Plus 0/5/1 and 2/8/2 "Support Fiora". 

https://i.gyazo.com/450b9f524aef3f5d515483f08a01ca54.png  again here, 2/14/4 75 cs in a 28 minute game, on your main champion.

https://i.gyazo.com/0be46bec18e7483fdc46f83ebb3a0673.png 0/9/1 30 cs in 18 minutes Mordekaier

I tried to leave out bad scores but good cs/good build but these are notably bad:

https://i.gyazo.com/0ac68c6304dd6e9b515293cfa79bf468.png 0/9/2 CLEANSE vayne
https://i.gyazo.com/9b9f10d17aea613425fa23a5a2231958.png 3/11/3 corki
https://i.gyazo.com/05b428bbce72dd4d4ef652c59fba6039.png 1/8/1 kennen

> [{quoted}](name=disregardable,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=KEwgVUvZ,comment-id=00030002,timestamp=2018-11-15T16:24:54.781+0000)
>
> ...

It depends on what division that person's in.  That could be Kadeem, you don't know.  You can't just assume everyone's inting just because they die a lot.

That guy was playing support Fiora in some of those games.  Literally support, not "I'm gonna' go support as Fiora and build damage items and try to steal all your kills."

But  would you report somebody that went support fiora and then 2/8/2?

I would.

Is it impossible he just gave up in those games after falling behind, considering he has a history of feeding?

don't think so.

> [{quoted}](name=disregardable,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=KEwgVUvZ,comment-id=0003000200000000,timestamp=2018-11-16T13:42:51.035+0000)
>
> But  would you report somebody that went support fiora and then 2/8/2?
> 
> I would.
> 
> Is it impossible he just gave up in those games after falling behind, considering he has a history of feeding?
> 
> don't think so.

Reporting someone for playing support Fiora _( which happens to be one of the games he done the best in, lol )_ is the same as reporting anyone not playing a meta pick or for being unskilled at the game.

The hole in your argument is that you're equating 'high number of deaths' with "intentionally feeding."  Those aren't the same things and the only thing you're drawing your conclusion on is the fact that he has a lot of deaths.

We don't have any footage of him running it down and context matters.

It'd help your argument if you didn't only show us games with horrible KDA.  You need something that proves he's actually good at the game to begin with, before you can even start to attribute his bad scores to intentionally feeding.

Does he have any games where he's stomping?  Any 15/1 Fiora games?

I'm just saying, if someone did report him, which is likely, that it would've counted if he did feed, and him feeding in those games where he did particularly badly is not unreasonable considering we have established a history of feeding.

> you're equating 'high number of deaths' with "intentionally feeding."

no, I'm equating low KDA and low CS with intentionally feeding. Only support fiora has to rely on KDA alone, and even then that's a trolling position. See point above.

I went through a month of my own match history out of curiosity, because I know I do bad too sometimes. I only found 2 games that'd qualify using the same system. 

>It'd help your argument if you didn't only show us games with horrible KDA

Pointing out that Fiora is his champion sufficiently does that. Obviously he has games with good KDA on Fiora, otherwise these games wouldn't stand out.

> [{quoted}](name=disregardable,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=KEwgVUvZ,comment-id=000300020000000000000000,timestamp=2018-11-16T14:13:01.488+0000)
>
> I'm just saying, if someone did report him, which is likely, that it would've counted if he did feed, and him feeding in those games where he did particularly badly is not unreasonable considering we have established a history of feeding.
> 
> no, I'm equating low KDA and low CS with intentionally feeding. Only support fiora has to rely on KDA alone, and even then that's a trolling position. See point above.
> 

> 
> Pointing out that Fiora is his champion sufficiently does that. Obviously he has games with good KDA on Fiora, otherwise these games wouldn't stand out.

You haven't established a history of INTENTIONALLY feeding, you've established a history of games where he's performed horribly.

You know who else has low KDA and low CS?  Bad players.
You know who else plays only one champion?  Bad players.
You know who else plays Fiora support?  Bad players.

You've not illustrated anything to differentiate him from someone who simply isn't good at the game and is trying to learn the game by playing a particular champion they like.

> I went through a month of my own match history out of curiosity, because I know I do bad too sometimes. I only found 2 games that'd qualify using the same system. 

Let's consider someone better than you looked at those games and said you were intentionally feeding because they don't have two games where they did that horribly.

Would they be right?  Were you intentionally feeding in those games?

> [{quoted}](name=disregardable,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=KEwgVUvZ,comment-id=00030002,timestamp=2018-11-15T16:24:54.781+0000)
>
> I found it. In total, if you think "support fiora" and the decent cs games aren't feeding, then it's a total of 4 games of inting in the month leading up to the ban. 9 games total that might have counted in the month leading up to the ban. The game that received the ban was the only game of hard inting from the start of the game, but there was still obvious inting in the others.
> 
> 
> https://i.gyazo.com/fe116243e639d871f20d8f8f71a43001.png 0/7/2 with 82 cs on your main champion really? Plus 0/5/1 and 2/8/2 "Support Fiora". 
> 
> https://i.gyazo.com/450b9f524aef3f5d515483f08a01ca54.png  again here, 2/14/4 75 cs in a 28 minute game, on your main champion.
> 
> https://i.gyazo.com/0be46bec18e7483fdc46f83ebb3a0673.png 0/9/1 30 cs in 18 minutes Mordekaier
> 
> I tried to leave out bad scores but good cs/good build but these are notably bad:
> 
> https://i.gyazo.com/0ac68c6304dd6e9b515293cfa79bf468.png 0/9/2 CLEANSE vayne
> https://i.gyazo.com/9b9f10d17aea613425fa23a5a2231958.png 3/11/3 corki
> https://i.gyazo.com/05b428bbce72dd4d4ef652c59fba6039.png 1/8/1 kennen

Dam who is that o.o

If you're expecting a message of a successful punishment to pop up every time, I'm gonna have bad news for ya.
Check their profiles on op.gg or just their match history and see if they have stopped playing for some days. If not, it'll just be a matter of time.
Don't ruin the game for others and yourself, not worth it mate.
14 days ban he meant chat restricted i think, becuase some players call it a ban too

To be fair, I think the report feedback system doesn't really work. I've reported around two dozen people for telling me or a teammate to kys, which I've seen is apparently a 0 tolerance phrase, and rightfully so, yet I have not once gotten a message indicating they were punished. And unless I'm mistaken, the feedback system is supposed to tell you if your report was the one that got them a punishment. So if it's 0 tolerance, and I reported them, I should definitely get a feedback message, but don't.

No.
The IFS does not show up for every successful report.

> [{quoted}](name=ﬂoo,realm=EUW,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=KEwgVUvZ,comment-id=00060000,timestamp=2018-11-16T12:28:43.150+0000)
>
> No.
> The IFS does not show up for every successful report.

The 0 tolerance doesnt work at all. I got made on a leveling account (pre-30), and like it or not, I told people to "kys" and called multiple people "n******". I got chat restricted.
And where is the part where it doesn't work?

i addressed a similar issue in my post an hour ago,
in short, players (especially low elo) are toxic 8/10 times (at least in euw, but was 3/10 toxic players in na)
and the sheer amount of toxic players make u think, is there even a punishment system? ( i know there is)

ban riot

~~toxic masculinity is the biggest joke of 2019 already~~
Player behaviour at it's finest.
huh? wat
A straw-man argument in support of a garbage automated ban system getting up-voted?  Move along, nothing to see.
